{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3054026,"name":"viggy96","username":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-27T16:39:05.383Z","cooked":"

I was looking at the swerve drive kinematics documentation on WPILib (Swerve Drive Kinematics — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation), and it was unclear whether the SwerveModuleState class used [0, 360] or [-180, +180] for the module angle.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2022-04-27T16:39:42.471Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":21,"reads":83,"readers_count":82,"score":121.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":410453,"topic_slug":"swervemodulestate-angle-range","display_username":"viggy96","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.wpilib.org/en/stable/docs/software/kinematics-and-odometry/swerve-drive-kinematics.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Swerve Drive Kinematics — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation","clicks":7}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24613,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart"},"post_url":"/t/swervemodulestate-angle-range/410453/1","custom_user_title":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3054031,"name":"Ryan Blue","username":"Ryan_Blue","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ryan_blue/{size}/174016_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-27T16:42:03.731Z","cooked":"

It takes a Rotation2d, which can take any angle with Rotation2d.fromDegrees(); 0 degrees is facing forward.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2022-04-27T16:42:41.371Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":82,"readers_count":81,"score":36.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":410453,"topic_slug":"swervemodulestate-angle-range","display_username":"Ryan Blue","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":29846,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"WPILib Dev | 1024 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/swervemodulestate-angle-range/410453/2","custom_user_title":"WPILib Dev | 1024 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3054194,"name":"viggy96","username":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-27T19:47:54.342Z","cooked":"

I’m aware that it’s a Rotation2d object. Let me rephrase.

If I’m at 0 degrees, and I turn the wheel left and right by 1 degree, should that correspond to -1 and +1 degree?

Or should it be +359 and +1 degree?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2022-04-27T19:47:54.342Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":69,"readers_count":68,"score":43.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":410453,"topic_slug":"swervemodulestate-angle-range","display_username":"viggy96","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":29846,"username":"Ryan_Blue","name":"Ryan Blue","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ryan_blue/{size}/174016_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24613,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart"},"post_url":"/t/swervemodulestate-angle-range/410453/3","custom_user_title":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3054210,"name":"kgzak","username":"kgzak","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kgzak/{size}/157079_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-27T20:22:09.489Z","cooked":"

Rotation2d.fromDegrees(-1) == Rotation2d.fromDegrees(359). They are the same thing.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2022-04-27T20:22:09.489Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":47,"readers_count":46,"score":39.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":410453,"topic_slug":"swervemodulestate-angle-range","display_username":"kgzak","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":24613,"username":"viggy96","name":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":11043,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/swervemodulestate-angle-range/410453/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3054228,"name":"Ryan Blue","username":"Ryan_Blue","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ryan_blue/{size}/174016_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-27T20:44:18.777Z","cooked":"

It shouldn’t matter since whatever you’re giving the SwerveModuleState to should be able to handle angles properly, and getSin and getCos will return the same.

Just out of personal curiosity, I ran a test to see what SwerveDriveKinematics returns and it looks like it bounds them within (-180,180).

kgzak:

Rotation2d.fromDegrees(-1) == Rotation2d.fromDegrees(359)

Semantically,

Rotation2d.fromDegrees(-1).equals(Rotation2d.fromDegrees(359))

But your point holds.

yes I did actually check this, the equals method just checks that the sin and cos are within a tolerance of each other.
